de.esoco.storage.mapping

Class ClassMapping<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.storage.mapping.AbstractStorageMapping<T,FieldDescriptor,ClassMapping<?>>
        • de.esoco.storage.mapping.ClassMapping<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StorageMapping<T,FieldDescriptor,ClassMapping<?>>, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class ClassMapping<T>
extends AbstractStorageMapping<T,FieldDescriptor,ClassMapping<?>>
    A storage mapping implementation that maps a class to storages. It uses reflection to analyze the structure of the class and creates a corresponding storage mapping. The analysis will only be performed on the first access to a corresponding method. Therefore instances of this class can also be used as a mere class identifier for storage implementations that don't need a mapping (like object oriented databases).

    To be mapped by this class the structure of a class must meet the following requirements:

    • Field names must follow the camel case pattern that is typical for Java code. They may have a single-letter prefix which will be omitted from the name that is used for storage fields.
    • The primary key field must have the name "id" (with an optional prefix as described before). If it's datatype is integer it will be mapped to an auto-increment database field.
    • Classes that are used as child elements of other mapped classes must have a field "parent" that references an object of the parent type. It will be mapped to an integer field that must be mappable to an integer ID field in the parent.
    • Child fields must be of a collection type and they must not be NULL. If no children are available the collection must be empty.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClassMapping

        public ClassMapping(java.lang.Class<T> rClass)
        Creates a new class-based storage mapping for a particular class. The simple name of the class (i.e. the name without package) will be set unchanged as the StorageRelationTypes.STORAGE_NAME relation of this mapping and can be changed afterwards if necessary.

        To be usable for all storage implementations the given class must have a public constructor without parameters so that new objects can be created by the createObject(List, boolean) method. If no such constructor exists an IllegalStateException will be thrown when the method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        rClass - The type to create the mapping for
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an element of the given class cannot be mapped

    • Method Detail

      • createObject

        public T createObject(java.util.List<?> rAttributeValues,
                      boolean bAsChild)
        This method must be implemented to return a new instance of the type that is described by this mapping. The argument is a list of the attribute values to be set in the new object. The list order will be the same in which the attribute descriptors are returned by StorageMapping.getAttributes(). The list may be empty but must never be NULL.
        Parameters:
        rAttributeValues - A list containing the attribute values
        bAsChild - TRUE if the object is read as a child of another object by the storage
        Returns:
        A new instance of the type described by this mapping, initialized with the given attribute values

      • getAttributeValue

        public java.lang.Object getAttributeValue(T rObject,
                                          FieldDescriptor rField)
                                   throws StorageException
        Returns the value of a certain attribute from the given object.
        Parameters:
        rObject - The object to query the value from
        rField - The descriptor of the attribute to return the value of
        Returns:
        The attribute value (may be NULL)
        Throws:
        StorageException - Implementations may throw an storage exception if a storage operation is required to access an attribute value and fails

        Returns:
        A collection containing the child mappings

        Parameters:
        rObject - The object to return the children of
        rChildMapping - The mapping that describes the type of the children
        Returns:

      • setChildren

        public void setChildren(T rParent,
                        java.util.List<?> rChildren,
                        ClassMapping<?> rChildMapping)
        Sets the children of a parent to a list of child elements. The given list MUST be used directly by the implementation because it may be a special object that implements storage access or similar.
        Parameters:
        rParent - The parent object to set the children of
        rChildren - The list of child elements
        rChildMapping - The mapping that describes the child type
